00044 typedef enum vp_colorspace_e
00045 {
00046     VP_UNKNOWN = -1,
00047     VP_IYUV    =  0,    
00048     VP_YV12    =  1,    
00049     VP_YUY2    =  2,    
00050     VP_YVYU    =  3,    
00051     VP_UYVY    =  4,    
00052     VP_RGB555  =  5,    
00053     VP_RGB565  =  6,    
00054     VP_RGB24   =  7,    
00055     VP_RGB32   =  8,    
00056     VP_YUV400  =  9,    
00057     VP_YUV422  = 10,    
00058     VP_TOTAL   = 11     
00059 } vp_colorspace_e;
00060 
00062 typedef struct vp_frame_t
00063 {
00064     int              width;         
00065     int              height;        
00066     vp_colorspace_e  colorspace;    
00067     int              bytes_per_pel; 
00068     int              luma_bits;     
00069     int              chroma_bits;   
00070     // data pointers and stride in bytes for frames:
00071     //      planar formats: data[0]=Y, data[1]=C1, data[2]=C2;
00072     //          where: C1=first chroma, C2=second chroma plane;
00073     //          example IYUV: data[0]=Y, data[1]=U, data[2]=V;
00074     //          example YV12: data[0]=Y, data[1]=V, data[2]=U;
00075     //      packed & RGB formats: data[0]=image;
00076     // data pointers and stride in bytes for separate fields:
00077     //      planar formats: data[0]=Y0, data[1]=C10, data[2]=C20, data[3]=Y1, data[4]=C11, data[5]=C21;
00078     //      packed & RGB formats: data[0]=field0, data[1]=field1;
00079     void            *data[6];
00080     int              stride[6];
00081     int              valid_rows_count;  
00082 } vp_frame_t;
00083

00202 typedef enum vp_target_e
00203 {
00204     VP_Y   = 1,
00205     VP_U   = 2,
00206     VP_V   = 4,
00207     VP_UV  = ((VP_U)  | (VP_V)),
00208     VP_YUV = ((VP_UV) | (VP_Y))
00209 } vp_target_e;

00212 typedef enum vp_filter_type_e
00213 {
00214     VP_BLUR3x3           = 0x10,
00215     VP_BLUR5x5           = 0x11,
00216 
00217     VP_SHARPEN3x3        = 0x20,
00218     VP_SHARPEN5x5        = 0x21,
00219 
00220     VP_MEDIAN3x3         = 0x30,
00221     VP_MEDIAN5x3         = 0x31,
00222 
00223     VP_TEMPORAL_DENOISE  = 0x40,
00224 
00225     VP_TELECINE          = 0x50,  // target must be VP_YUV, param0 and param1 ignored
00226     VP_DEINTERLACE       = 0x60,  // target must be VP_YUV, param0 is deinterlace type, param1 ignored
00227     VP_RESIZE            = 0x70,  // target must be VP_YUV, param0 width, param1 height
00228     VP_COLORSPACE        = 0x80,  // target must be VP_YUV, param0 colorspace, param1 ignored
00229 
00230     VP_POSTFILTER_2D     = 0x90,  // target must be VP_YUV, param0 filter_size_x, param1 filter_size_y
00231     VP_POSTFILTER_1D     = 0x91   // target must be VP_YUV, param0 filter_size, param1 ignored
00232 } vp_filter_type_e;

00336 typedef enum vp_telecine_fields_e

00338     VP_OLD_TOP_FIELD   = 1,
00339     VP_OLD_BOT_FIELD   = 2,
00340     VP_NEW_TOP_FIELD   = 4,
00341     VP_NEW_BOT_FIELD   = 8
00342 } vp_telecine_fields_e;
00343 
00345 typedef enum vp_telecine_cmd_e
00346 {
00347     VP_DIRECT          = 0,                                     // means do new frame in dst and don't cache it
00348     VP_OLD_FRAME       = (VP_OLD_TOP_FIELD | VP_OLD_BOT_FIELD), // means copy cached frame to dst frame
00349     VP_NEW_FRAME       = (VP_NEW_TOP_FIELD | VP_NEW_BOT_FIELD), // means process frame cache it and copy it to dst
00350     VP_NEW_TOP_OLD_BOT = (VP_NEW_TOP_FIELD | VP_OLD_BOT_FIELD), // means process frame and
00351     VP_OLD_TOP_NEW_BOT = (VP_OLD_TOP_FIELD | VP_NEW_BOT_FIELD)
00352 } vp_telecine_cmd_e;

00441 
00442 // show next frame pair to calulator ...
00443 // returns 0 - OK, 1 - OK, but no more frames will be accepted before result is retrieved; or error code
00444 int vqm_next_frame_pair(struct vqm_context_t *vqm_context, vqm_frame_t *orig, vqm_frame_t *rec);
00445 
00446 // show next frame pair to calulator ...
00447 // returns 0 - OK, 1 - OK, but no more frames will be accepted before result is retrieved; 
00448 // 2 - OK,  but detected scene change; 
00449 // or error code;
00450 int vqm_next_frame_pair_modif(struct vqm_context_t *vqm_context, vqm_frame_t *orig, vqm_frame_t *rec);
